Furthermore, the United States, which has been a key ally of the Kurds in Iraq and Syria, has not supported their independence aspirations and has instead advocated for a unified Iraq and Syria.

Taking into account the geopolitical complexities and the opposition from regional powers, I estimate that the probability of a Kurdish state being admitted as a member state of the United Nations by the beginning of 2030 is very low.
